questions.question: The most immediate and important outcome of the Civil War was that:

choices.answer: The South was able to become an industrial center.
The South gained its independence.
Tensions between different areas of the nation ended.
Slavery was ended in the US.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the economy of SC after the Civil War?

choices.answer: The economy was devastated.
The economy changed immediately to industry.
The economy stayed the same, no change.
The economy improved quickly.

questions.question: Which of the following describes Lincoln's 10 Percent Plan?

choices.answer: 10 percent of the states in the US agreed it could enter
10 percent of voters took an oath of loyalty to the US.
10 percent of the damages from the Civil War were repaid.
The state got 10 percent less representation in the govt.

questions.question: Why did Congress not like the Presidential plans for Reconstruction?

choices.answer: The plans were too strict on the South.
The plans were created too quickly.
The plans were too lenient (or easy) on the South.
The plans helped Freedmen, but not poor white farmers.

questions.question: What was the theme of the Reconstruction Amendments?

choices.answer: Equal treatment for all citizens.
Freedom from cruel and unusual punishments.
Freedom of speech.
Right to a fair trial.

questions.question: What was the primary goal of the Freedmen's Bureau?

choices.answer: Establish a sharecropping system to employ former slaves.
Provide former slaves w/ food, shelter, work, and education.
To enforce the Black Codes.
Prevent African Americans from voting.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the 13th amendment?

choices.answer: Gave African Americans the right to vote.
Allowed former Confederate states back in the Union.
Gave women the right to vote.
Abolished slavery.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the 14th amendment?

choices.answer: Gave African Americans the right to vote.
Gave citizenship to former slaves.
Abolished slavery.
Terminated the government of the Confederacy.

questions.question: Laws passed that regulated the work done by African Americans after the Civil War were

choices.answer: Farm Laws.
Black Codes.
Reconstruction Regulations.
Codes of Conduct.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the 15th Amendment?

choices.answer: Established the income tax.
Ended Reconstruction Era.
Gave women the right to vote.
Gave African American men the right to vote.

questions.question: Which of the following describes racial relations in South Carolina during Reconstruction?

choices.answer: AA preferred upper class whites vote on important issues.
Racial tensions improved after the war.
Racial tensions increased as AA gained political power.
Freed slaves began voting w/ help from former owners.

questions.question: Why did many former slaves become sharecroppers?

choices.answer: To avoid working in factories.
Sharecroppers were treated better than paid workers.
Crops like cotton were more valuable than cash.
There were few paying jobs available.

questions.question: Why did people in the South dislike carpetbaggers?

choices.answer: They added to the over-crowed population in the South.
They stopped SC from organizing another rebellion.
They tried to make SC cities like cities in the North.
They profited from the destruction in the South.

questions.question: What group was formed in 1866 and used violence against former slaves?

choices.answer: Ku Klux Klan
Black Separatists
Sons of the Confederacy
Neo-Nazis
Veterans of the Civil War who refused to become civilians.
Northerners who move south and took advantage of the South.
Southerners who sympathized with Republicans.
Newly freed slaves who competed with whites for jobs.
